intro: Leonardoxa bequaertii, commonly known as the African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, orange-red flowers. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, with a broad, spreading canopy. Its bark is smooth and grayish, often exfoliating to reveal a lighter inner layer. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
